intro: Chonemorpha mollissima, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in wetlands or disturbed soils. Chonemorpha mollissima is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
